thread.title: Cheyenne Concert Association opens season with Neil Diamond Tribute
thread.title_full: Cheyenne Concert Association opens season with Neil Diamond Tribute

title: Cheyenne Concert Association opens season with Neil Diamond Tribute
text: Legal Information Cheyenne Concert Association opens season with Neil Diamond Tribute The Cheyenne Concert Association will kick off its 2015-16 concert series with A Tribute to Neil Diamond, performed by Denny Diamond and the Jewels.All shows except for the Diamond tribute take place at Cheyenne's Central High, 5500 Education Drive. Single tickets cost $20. To reserve a ticket, call 307-214-7076 . For more details, visit www.cheyenneconcert.com . TRIBUTE TO NEIL DIAMOND When: Oct. 20, 7:30 p.m. Where: Cheyenne East High, 2800 E. Pershing Blvd. About: Denny Diamond performs with his two sons, Lucas and Spenser. The show is compromised mostly of Neil Diamond songs, but there are also songs from Johnny Cash, Ricky Nelson and Glen Campbell. The family band will perform some original music, too. THE INTERNATIONAL STRING TRIO When: Nov. 1, 4 p.m. About: The International String Trio is a group of musicians, all alumni of Boston's Berklee College of Music, performing Gypsy jazz, bluegrass, popular songs and other styles of music. ROBERT SIMS When: March 10, 7:30 p.m. About: Robert Sims is a baritone singer and has won the gold medal of the American Traditions Competition. He has performed with various orchestras, toured in multiple countries and was featured in a televised performance of Bernstein's "Opening Prayer." LINK UNION When: April 22, 7:30 p.m. About: An eight-member family band, Link Union plays Americana music, as well as classic rock, Celtic and mountain music. They use 16 instruments during their shows and have performed more than 2,000 shows over the U.S. and Canada, traveling the country in their 45-foot Silver Eagle bus. Published on: Tuesday, Oct 20, 2015 - 08:37:25 am MDT By the ToDo staff
